creator: bonhamcm@thirdeyeconsulting.com
text:
I'm load testing an application and trying to interpret session usage.  
Sessions were created and destroyed, but never activated or passivated.  Upon 
looking at the code for StandardSession.activate() and passivate(), I noticed 
that the attributes were used instead of listeners in order to find any 
HttpSessionActivationListeners to notify.  This doesn't seem like the correct 
behavior, so I've added a patch to rectify it.

Thanks.

--
Chris Bonham
President/CEO
Third Eye Consulting, Inc.
bonhamcm@thirdeyeconsulting.com
http://www.thirdeyeconsulting.com
317.823.3686
317.823.0353 (FAX)

I can see anything wrong with the current behaviour. I am setting this as 
INVALID. If you disagree and re-open this please explain, using the spec, why 
the current behaviour is wrong.
creator: markt@apache.org
bonhamcm@thirdeyeconsulting.com
text: Sorry, this was my misinterpretation of the Servlet 2.3 specification.
